body_html:
Hi @tatatodd,

I installed both tensorflow and models from source. But even installing tensorflow from source, we still need pip to install it in the last step.

Based on tensorflow document, "When building from source, you will still build a pip package and install that." And the last step is
"$ sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-py2-none-any.whl"

That's why I have two locations. /cm/shared/scratch/rengan/DL/tensorflow is the location of tensorflow source code. And /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow is the installed location after installation from source, or where the above command "pip install" installed to.

I think the issue here is the out-of-sync between tensorflow and models repos. Perhaps models used some module not available on tensorflow repo anymore. But inception-v3 in models repo is the only distributed training example I could find. If there is any other distributed training model example in tensorflow repo, please let me know. Thanks.

body:
Hi @tatatodd, 

I installed both tensorflow and models from source. But even installing tensorflow from source, we still need pip to install it in the last step. 

Based on tensorflow document, "When building from source, you will still build a pip package and install that." And the last step is 
"$ sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-py2-none-any.whl"

That's why I have two locations. /cm/shared/scratch/rengan/DL/tensorflow is the location of tensorflow source code. And /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow is the installed location after installation from source, or where the above command "pip install" installed to.

I think the issue here is the out-of-sync between tensorflow and models repos. Perhaps models used some module not available on tensorflow repo anymore. But inception-v3 in models repo is the only distributed training example I could find. If there is any other distributed training model example in tensorflow repo, please let me know. Thanks.
